member.summary: Provider for clients with credentials for specific users

member.name: M:Polymarket.Net.Interfaces.Clients.IPolymarketUserClientProvider.InitializeUserClient(System.String,Polymarket.Net.Objects.PolymarketCredentials,Polymarket.Net.PolymarketEnvironment)
member.summary: Initialize a client for the specified user identifier. This can be used so to initialize a client for a user so ApiCredentials do not need to be passed later.

member.name: M:Polymarket.Net.Interfaces.Clients.IPolymarketUserClientProvider.ClearUserClients(System.String)
member.summary: Reset the cached clients for a user. This can be useful when a user changes API credentials.

member.name: M:Polymarket.Net.Interfaces.Clients.IPolymarketUserClientProvider.GetRestClient(System.String,Polymarket.Net.Objects.PolymarketCredentials,Polymarket.Net.PolymarketEnvironment)
member.summary: Get the Rest client for a specific user. In case the client does not exist yet it will be created and the should be provided, unless has been called prior for this user.
member.param: The credentials for the user. Required the first time a client is requested for this user unless has been called prior for this user.

member.name: M:Polymarket.Net.Interfaces.Clients.IPolymarketUserClientProvider.GetSocketClient(System.String,Polymarket.Net.Objects.PolymarketCredentials,Polymarket.Net.PolymarketEnvironment)
member.summary: Get the Socket client for a specific user. In case the client does not exist yet it will be created and the should be provided, unless has been called prior for this user.
member.param: The credentials for the user. Required the first time a client is requested for this user unless has been called prior for this user.

member.name: T:Polymarket.Net.SymbolOrderBooks.PolymarketClobSymbolOrderBook
member.summary: Implementation for a synchronized order book. After calling Start the order book will sync itself and keep up to date with new data. It will automatically try to reconnect and resync in case of a lost/interrupted connection. Make sure to check the State property to see if the order book is synced.
